Welcome to Photo SHAKE App documentation!¶

Photo SHAKE App main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is used to check the health of the database. It returns a welcome message if it can connect to the database, and an error message otherwise.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with a message

async main.root()¶

The root function is a simple HTTP endpoint that returns a welcome message.

Returns:

A dictionary

Photo SHAKE App database Db¶

app.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function opens a new database connection if there is none yet for the current application context. It will also create the database tables if they don’t exist yet.

Returns:

A context manager that provides a database session

Photo SHAKE App repository Comment¶

async app.repository.comment.create_comment(image_id: int, body: CommentBase, user: User, db: Session) → ImageComment¶

The create_comment function creates a new comment for an image.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image that is being commented on

  • body – CommentBase: Get the comment_description from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of comments

async app.repository.comment.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → None¶

The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the id of the comment to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete a comment

Returns:

A comment

async app.repository.comment.edit_comment(comment_id: int, body: CommentBase, db: Session, user: User) → ImageComment | None¶

The edit_comment function allows a user to edit their own comment.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Find the comment in the database

  • body – CommentBase: Pass the data to update the comment

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to edit the comment

Returns:

The updated comment or none if the comment with the specified id was not found

async app.repository.comment.show_my_comments(user_id: int, image_id: int, db: Session) → List[ImageComment] | None¶

The show_my_comments function returns a list of comments made by the user on an image.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Filter the comments by user_id

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session, which is used to query the database

Returns:

A list of ImageComment objects

async app.repository.comment.show_single_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → ImageComment | None¶

The show_single_comment function returns a single comment from the database.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment that is being requested

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to view the comment

Returns:

An ImageComment object or none

async app.repository.comment.show_user_photo_comments(user_id: int, image_id: int, db: Session) → List[ImageComment] | None¶

The show_user_photo_comments function returns a list of comments for a given user’s photo.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user id of the user whose comments are being requested

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of ImageComment objects

Photo SHAKE App repository Photo¶

async app.repository.photo.create_photo(title: str, description: str, tags: str, file: UploadFile, db: Session, current_user: User) → Image¶

The create_photo function creates a new photo in the database.

Parameters:

  • title – str: Set the title of the image

  • description – str: Store the description of the image

  • tags – str: Get the tags from the request body

  • file – UploadFile: Pass the image file to the cloudinary uploader

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user who is logged in

Returns:

A image object

async app.repository.photo.get_my_photos(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Image]¶

The get_my_photos function returns a list of images that belong to the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first x number of images

  • limit – int: Limit the number of photos returned

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of images that are owned by the user

async app.repository.photo.get_photo_by_id(photo_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Image¶

The get_photo_by_id function returns a photo by its id.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the id of the photo that we want to retrieve

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authenticated and has access to the photo

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A photo by its id

async app.repository.photo.remove_photo(photo_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Image | None¶

The remove_photo function removes a photo from the database and cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the id of the photo to be deleted

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete the photo

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The photo object that was deleted

async app.repository.photo.update_description(photo_id: int, title: str, description: str, tags: str, user: User, db: Session) → Image | None¶

The update_description function updates the title, description or tags of a photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Identify which photo to update

  • title – str: Update the title of a photo

  • description – str: Update the description of an image

  • tags – str: Get the tags from the request body

  • user – User: Check if the user is the owner of the photo

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The photo object if the update was successful, none otherwise

Photo SHAKE App repository Tags¶

async app.repository.tags.create_tag(values: List[ImageTagModel], db: Session) → ImageTag¶

The create_tag function takes a list of ImageTagModel objects and a database session.

Parameters:

  • values – List[ImageTagModel]: Pass the list of tags to be created

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of ImageTag objects

async app.repository.tags.get_tag_by_id(tag_id: int, db: Session) → ImageTag¶

The get_tag_by_id function returns the ImageTag object with the given tag_id.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the id of the tag to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single ImageTag object

async app.repository.tags.get_tags(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[ImageTag]¶

The get_tags function returns a list of ImageTag objects.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n tags

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of ImageTag objects

async app.repository.tags.get_tags_by_list_values(values: List[ImageTagModel], db: Session) → List[ImageTag]¶

The get_tags_by_list_values function takes a list of ImageTagModel objects and returns a list of ImageTag objects.

Parameters:

  • values – List[ImageTagModel]: Pass in a list of ImageTagModel objects

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of ImageTag objects

async app.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session) → ImageTag | None¶

The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the id of the tag to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The tag that was deleted, or none if no such tag existed

async app.repository.tags.update_tag(tag_id: int, body: ImageTagModel, db: Session) → ImageTag | None¶

The update_tag function updates an existing tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Identify the tag to update

  • body – ImageTagModel: Get the tag_name from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated tag

Photo SHAKE App repository Transform_photo¶

async app.repository.transform_photo.show_qr(photo_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Image | None¶

The show_qr function takes a photo_id and user, and returns an image of the QR code for that photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo from the database

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A buffer, which is a memory-only file

async app.repository.transform_photo.transform_method(photo_id: int, body: TransformBodyModel, user: User, db: Session) → Image | None¶

The transform_method function creates a transformation list that will be used to transform the image using Cloudinary’s API. The function then checks if each filter is being used by checking if its use_filter attribute is True or False. If True, it adds all of its attributes to the transformation list as parameters for Cloudinary’s API call.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo from the database

  • body – TransformBodyModel: Pass the data from the frontend to this function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The photo object with the new transform_url

Photo SHAKE App repository Users¶

async app.repository.users.activate_user(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The activate_user function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user with that email from the database. The activate_user function then sets is_active to True for that user, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to activate

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.ban_user(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The ban_user function takes an email address and a database connection, and sets the user’s is_active flag to False.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be banned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.delete_user(user_id: int, db: Session) → None¶

The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the id of the user to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.get_me(user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_me function returns the user object of the currently logged in user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.get_user_profile(username: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_profile function returns a UserProfileModel object containing the user’s username, email, avatar, created_at date and time (in UTC), is_active status (True or False), photo count and comment count.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is trying to access their profile

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.get_users(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[User]¶

The get_users function returns a list of users from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of users

async app.repository.users.make_user_role(email: str, role: Role, db: Session) → None¶

The make_user_role function takes an email and a role, then finds the user with that email in the database. It then sets that user’s role to be equal to the given role.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • role – Role: Specify the role of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.remove_from_ban(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The remove_from_ban function removes a user from the ban list.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of parameter that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

async app.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh_token field in the user table

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.update_user_inform(email: str, username: str | None, password: str | None, db: Session) → User¶

The update_user_inform function updates the user’s information in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Identify the user in the database

  • username – str | None: Check if the username is a string or none

  • password – str | None: Update the password of a user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Photo SHAKE App routes Auth¶

async app.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, an HTTP 400 error is returned with a detail message of &quot;Verification error&quot;.

If they do exist but their confirmed field is already set to True (meaning their email has already been confirmed), then we return a JSON response saying so. Otherwise, we call our repository_users function confirmed_email() which

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the message &quot;email confirmed&quot;

async app.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and a bearer type

async app.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the keys access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async app.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link to confirm their account. The function takes in the body of the request, which contains only one field: email. It then uses this information to query for a user in our database and if it finds one, sends them an email with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background_tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary {‘message’: ‘check your email for confirmation’}

async app.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: user and detail

Photo SHAKE App routes Comment¶

async app.routes.comment.by_user_comments(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The by_user_comments function returns all comments made by a user.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user whose comments are being returned. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): User object for the currently logged in user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Pass the user_id of the user whose comments are to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

A list of comments

async app.routes.comment.by_user_photo_comments(user_id: int, image_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The by_user_photo_comments function returns a list of comments for a specific user and photo.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • user_id: int, the id of the user whose comments are being returned.

  • image_id: int, the id of the image whose comments are being returned.

The function returns a list containing all comment objects that match both parameters.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id of the user who commented on a photo

  • image_id – int: Identify the photo that the comment is associated with

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of comments

async app.routes.comment.create_comment(image_id: int, body: CommentBase, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_comment function creates a new comment for the image with the given ID.

The user who created this comment is stored in the database as well.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image that the comment is being made on

  • body – CommentBase: Get the body of the comment

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A comment object

async app.routes.comment.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the comment to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that comment.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the comment to delete

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is making the request

Returns:

The deleted comment

async app.routes.comment.edit_comment(comment_id: int, body: CommentBase, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The edit_comment function allows a user to edit their own comment.

The function takes in the comment_id, body, db and current_user as parameters. It then calls the edit_comment function from repository/comment.py which returns an edited comment object if successful or None if not successful.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment to edit

  • body – CommentBase: Pass the new comment body to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A commentbase object, which is a pydantic model

async app.routes.comment.single_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The single_comment function returns a single comment from the database.

The function takes in an integer, comment_id, and uses it to query the database for a single comment. If no such comment exists, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 404 and detail &quot;Comment not found&quot;. Otherwise, the function returns that single Comment object.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Get the comment_id from the url

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A comment object

Photo SHAKE App routes Photo¶

async app.routes.photo.create_photo(title: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), description: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), tags: str = Form(None), file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_photo function creates a new photo in the database.

The function takes in a title, description, tags (optional), and file. It then uses the repository_photo module to create the photo.

Parameters:

  • title – str: Get the title of the photo from the form

  • description – str: Store the description of the photo

  • tags – str: Pass the tags to the create_photo function

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A tuple of the photo object and a list of tag objects

async app.routes.photo.remove_photo(photo_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_photo function removes a photo from the database.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to be removed. db (Session, optional): A database session object for interacting with the database. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): The user currently logged in and making this request. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A photo object

async app.routes.photo.see_my_photos(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 25, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The see_my_photos function returns a list of photos that the current user has uploaded.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n photos

  • limit – int: Limit the number of photos returned

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of photos

async app.routes.photo.see_one_photo(photo_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The see_one_photo function returns a single photo by id.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to be returned. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): User object with user information from auth token payload. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the id of the photo to be viewed

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A photo object

async app.routes.photo.update_description(photo_id: int, title: str = Form(None), description: str = Form(None), tags: str = Form(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_description function updates the description of a photo.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of a photo, and three strings representing title, description and tags respectively. It also takes in two dependencies: db (a database session) and current_user (the user who is currently logged into the application).

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Find the photo in the database

  • title – str: Update the title of a photo

  • description – str: Update the description of a photo

  • tags – str: Update the tags of a photo

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

The photo object

Photo SHAKE App routes Tags¶

async app.routes.tags.create_tag(tags: List[ImageTagModel], current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • tags – List[ImageTagModel]: Pass in a list of tags to create

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of imagetagmodel objects

async app.routes.tags.read_tag(tag_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The read_tag function returns a single tag by its ID.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Get the tag id from the url

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A tag object

async app.routes.tags.read_tags(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 25, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The read_tags function returns a list of tags.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n tags in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags returned

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of tags

async app.routes.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.
Args:

tag_id (int): The id of the tag to be removed. current_user (User): The user who is making this request. db (Session): A connection to the database, provided by FastAPI’s dependency injection system.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the tag that will be removed

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

The removed tag

async app.routes.tags.update_tag(body: ImageTagModel, tag_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_tag function updates a tag in the database.

The function takes an ImageTagModel object, which is used to update the tag’s name and description. It also takes a tag_id, which is used to find the correct tag in the database. Finally it takes current_user and db as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • body – ImageTagModel: Get the data from the request body

  • tag_id – int: Identify the tag to be updated

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A tag object

Photo SHAKE App routes Transform_photo¶

async app.routes.transform_photo.show_qr(photo_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The show_qr function returns a QR code for the photo with the given ID.

The QR code is generated using the photo’s URL and can be used to quickly access it.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the photo that we want to get the qr code for

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A streamingresponse object

async app.routes.transform_photo.transform_method(photo_id: int, body: TransformBodyModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The transform_method function takes a photo_id and a TransformBodyModel object,
which contains the following fields:
  • transform_type (str): The type of transformation to be applied.

    Currently supported values are &quot;rotate&quot; and &quot;flip&quot;.

  • degrees (int): The number of degrees to rotate the image by. Only used if transform_type is set to &quot;rotate&quot;.

    If not specified, defaults to 90. Must be one of 0, 90, 180 or 270. Any other value will result in an error response.&lt;/code&gt;

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo from the database

  • body – TransformBodyModel: Get the body of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The photo object

Photo SHAKE App routes Users¶

async app.routes.users.ban_user_by_email(body: RequestEmail, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The ban_user_by_email function takes a user’s email address and bans the user from accessing the API.

If the email is not found in our database, an HTTPException is raised with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &amp;quot;Invalid Email&amp;quot;. If the user has already been banned, an HTTPException is raised with status code 409 (Conflict) and detail message &amp;quot;User Already Not Active&amp;quot;. Otherwise, if no exceptions are thrown, we return a JSON object containing key-value pair {&amp;quot;message&amp;quot;

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the message

async app.routes.users.make_role_by_email(body: RequestRole, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The make_role_by_email function is used to change the role of a user.

The function takes in an email and a role, and changes the user’s role to that specified by the inputted parameters. If no such user exists, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid Email&quot;. If the new role matches that of the current one, then a message saying so will be returned. Otherwise, if all goes well, then a success message will be returned.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestRole: Get the email and role from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

async app.routes.users.read_all_users(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The read_all_users function returns a list of users.

— get:

summary: Returns all users. description: This can only be done by the logged in user. operationId: read_all_users parameters:

  • name: skip (optional) # The number of records to skip before returning results, default is 0 (no records skipped). Used for pagination purposes. See https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/cursor.skip/#cursor-skip-examples for more information on how this

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of users

Photo SHAKE App services Auth¶

class app.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secretkey'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include all of the claims that you want to make about this token, including any custom claims that you have defined. expires_delta (Optional[float]): A timedelta object representing how long this token will be valid for before it expires and is no longer usable by clients. If not provided, defaults to 180 minutes from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A string, which is the encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token.

The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) claim is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time until expiration of the token, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A token that contains the following:

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired. If the token is valid, it will return a string with the email address of user who owns that refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who requested the refresh token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token from the request header to the function

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from within it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A password hash

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password from the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

True if the password is correct and false otherwise

Photo SHAKE App services Emailtogo¶

async app.services.emailtogo.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account. -username: the username of the account that was just created. -host: this is used in conjunction with FastMail’s API to create a URL that will be sent

via email and allow users to verify their accounts.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server where this app is running

Returns:

A coroutine object

Photo SHAKE App services Photo¶

app.services.photo.validate_crop_mode(crop_mode)¶

Validate Crop Mode

This function validates if a given crop mode is one of the allowed crop modes.

Parameters:

crop_mode (str) – The crop mode to be validated.

Returns:

True if the crop mode is valid.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the crop mode is not in the list of allowed crop modes.

Example Usage:

validate_crop_mode('square')  # Returns True
app.services.photo.validate_gravity_mode(gravity_mode)¶

Validate Gravity Mode

This function validates if a given gravity mode is one of the allowed gravity modes.

Parameters:

gravity_mode (str) – The gravity mode to be validated.

Returns:

True if the gravity mode is valid.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the gravity mode is not in the list of allowed gravity modes.

Example Usage:

validate_gravity_mode('center')  # Returns True
